Posts.Content: Hello. Myself and sister both had double MX this year (different health authorities). My sister went for immediate implants with mesh. I think a lot of the time this works really well but my surgeon did say that there is a certain degree of risk with that procedure. Like you, she unfortunately had scars that wouldn't heal. Was off work for 3 months and on antibiotics for two months and at one point surgeon thought one of the implants would fail. In the end (to her surprise) they managed to save it but she lost both nipples. I'm a bit more of a worrier plus have just finished chemo and also have an ongoing blood clotting problem so went in the end for expanders rather than mesh etc. My surgeon advised me this is an older procedure and  whilst it is more hassle and possibly doesn't look as good in the end you are  less likely to have problems with healing. The expander is totally under the muscle - ouch - but that means you don't get that thin/stretched skin over the implant issue (my sister thinks this was the cause of her problems). My op was 12 days ago and though it looks a bugger it has healed really well (despite chemo and clotting problems). Still a bit sore but out walking dog every day last week. Not sure if this is of any use but thought I'd share our experiences - maybe in case you have a break from it all then think about revisiting it. Anyway, Good luck with it all CB
